asClass.name: Steady
asClass.description: The Steady counter causes the emitter to emit particles continuously at a steady rate. It can be used to simulate any continuous particle stream. The rate can also be varied by setting a range of value for the emission rate.
asClass.shortDescription: The Steady counter causes the emitter to emit particles continuously at a steady rate.

method.name: startEmitter
method.shortDescription: The startEmitter method is called when the emitter starts.

method.name: updateEmitter
method.shortDescription: The updateEmitter method is called every frame after the emitter has started.

constructor.name: Steady
constructor.description:
The constructor creates a Steady counter for use by an emitter. To add a Steady counter to an emitter use the emitter's setCounter method.

If two parameters are passed to the constructor then a random value between the two is used. This allows for random variation in the emission rate over the lifetime of the emitter. Otherwise the single value passed in is used.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a Steady counter for use by an emitter.

param.name: rateMin
param.description: The minimum number of particles to emit per second.

param.name: rateMax
param.description: The maximum number of particles to emit per second. If not set then the emitter will emit exactly the rateMin number of particles per second.

method.description: Resumes the emitter after a stop
method.shortDescription: Resumes the emitter after a stop

field.description: When setting, this property sets both rateMin and rateMax to the same value. When reading, this property is the average of rateMin and rateMax.
field.shortDescription: When setting, this property sets both rateMin and rateMax to the same value.

asClass.name: PerformanceAdjusted
asClass.description: The PerformanceAdjusted counter causes the emitter to emit particles continuously at a steady rate. It then adjusts this rate downwards if the frame rate is below a target frame rate.
asClass.shortDescription: The PerformanceAdjusted counter causes the emitter to emit particles continuously at a steady rate.

method.name: startEmitter
method.shortDescription: The startEmitter method is called when the emitter starts.

method.name: updateEmitter
method.shortDescription: The updateEmitter method is called every frame after the emitter has started.

constructor.name: PerformanceAdjusted
constructor.description: The constructor creates a PerformanceAdjusted counter for use by an emitter. To add a PerformanceAdjusted counter to an emitter use the emitter's setCounter method.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a PerformanceAdjusted counter for use by an emitter.

param.name: rateMin
param.description: The minimum number of particles to emit per second. The counter will never drop the rate below this value.

param.name: rateMax
param.description: The maximum number of particles to emit per second. the counter will start at this rate and adjust downwards if the frame rate is too slow.

param.name: targetFrameRate
param.description: The frame rate that the counter should aim for. Always set this slightly below your actual frame rate since flash will drop frames occasionally even when performance is fine. So, for example, if your movie's frame rate is 30fps and you want to target this rate, set the target rate to 26fps or so.

asClass.name: TimePeriod
asClass.description: The TimePeriod counter causes the emitter to emit particles for a period of time and then stop. The rate of emission over that period can be modified using easing equations thet conform to the interface defined in Robert Penner's easing equations. An update to these equations is included in the org.flintparticles.easing package.
asClass.shortDescription: The TimePeriod counter causes the emitter to emit particles for a period of time and then stop.

method.name: startEmitter
method.shortDescription: The startEmitter method is called when the emitter starts.

constructor.name: TimePeriod
constructor.description: The constructor creates a TimePeriod counter for use by an emitter. To add a TimePeriod counter to an emitter use the emitter's setCounter method.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a TimePeriod counter for use by an emitter.

param.name: numParticles
param.description: The number of particles to emit over the full duration of the time period

param.name: duration
param.description: The duration of the time period. After this time is up the emitter will not release any more particles.

param.name: easing
param.description: An easing function used to distribute the emission of the particles over the time period. If no easing function is passed a simple linear distribution is used in which particles are emitted at a constant rate over the time period.

asClass.name: Blast
asClass.description: The Blast counter causes the emitter to emit a single burst of particles when it starts and then emit no further particles. It is used, for example, to simulate an explosion.
asClass.shortDescription: The Blast counter causes the emitter to emit a single burst of particles when it starts and then emit no further particles.

method.shortDescription: The startEmitter method is called when the emitter starts.

constructor.name: Blast
constructor.description:
The constructor creates a Blast counter for use by an emitter. To add a Blast counter to an emitter use the emitter's setCounter method.

If two parameters are passed to the constructor then a random value between the two is used. This allows for some variation between emitters using the same Blast settings. Otherwise the single value passed in is used.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a Blast counter for use by an emitter.

param.description: The minimum number of particles to emit when the emitter starts.

param.description: The maximum number of particles to emit when the emitter starts. If not set then the emitter will emit exactly the startMin number of particles.

asClass.name: ZeroCounter
asClass.description: The Zero counter causes the emitter to emit no particles. Because the emitter requires a counter, this counter is used as the default and should be used whenever you don't want a counter.

asClass.name: Counter
asClass.description:
The Counter interface must be implemented by all counters.

A counter is a class that tells an emitter how many particles to emit at any time. The two methods allow the emission of particles when the emitter starts and every frame thereafter.

A counter is set for an emitter using the emitter's setCounter method.
asClass.shortDescription: The Counter interface must be implemented by all counters.

asClass.name: BitmapDataZone
asClass.description: The BitmapData zone defines a shaped zone based on a BitmapData object. The zone contains all pixels in the bitmap that are not transparent - i.e. they have an alpha value greater than zero.
asClass.shortDescription: The BitmapData zone defines a shaped zone based on a BitmapData object.

asClass.name: Zone
asClass.description:
The Zones interface must be implemented by all zones.

A zone is a class that defined a region in 2d space. The two required methods make it easy to get a random point within the zone and to find whether a specific point is within the zone. Zones are used to define the start location for particles (in the Position initializer), to define the start velocity for particles (in the Velocity initializer), and to define zones within which the particles die.
asClass.shortDescription: The Zones interface must be implemented by all zones.

method.description: The contains method determines whether a point is inside the zone.

asClass.name: GreyscaleZone

asClass.name: DisplayObjectZone
asClass.description: The DisplayObjectZone zone defines a shaped zone based on a DisplayObject. The zone contains the shape of the DisplayObject. The DisplayObject must be on the stage for it to be used, since it's position on stage determines the position of the zone.
asClass.shortDescription: The DisplayObjectZone zone defines a shaped zone based on a DisplayObject.

method.description: The getLocation method returns a random point inside the zone.
method.shortDescription: The getLocation method returns a random point inside the zone.

asClass.name: DiscSectorZone
asClass.description: The DiscSectorZone zone defines a section of a Disc zone. The disc on which it's based have a hole in the middle, like a doughnut.

method.name: contains
method.shortDescription: The contains method determines whether a point is inside the zone.

method.name: getArea

constructor.name: DiscSectorZone
constructor.description: The constructor defines a DiscSectorZone zone.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor defines a DiscSectorZone zone.

param.name: center
param.description: The centre of the disc.

param.name: outerRadius
param.description: The radius of the outer edge of the disc.

param.name: innerRadius
param.description: If set, this defines the radius of the inner edge of the disc. Points closer to the center than this inner radius are excluded from the zone. If this parameter is not set then all points inside the outer radius are included in the zone.

param.name: minAngle
param.description: The minimum angle, in radians, for points to be included in the zone. An angle of zero is horizontal and to the right. Positive angles are in a clockwise direction (towards the graphical y axis). Angles are converted to a value between 0 and two times PI.

param.name: maxAngle
param.description: The maximum angle, in radians, for points to be included in the zone. An angle of zero is horizontal and to the right. Positive angles are in a clockwise direction (towards the graphical y axis). Angles are converted to a value between 0 and two times PI.

method.name: contains
method.description: The contains method determines whether a point is inside the zone. This method is used by the initializers and actions that use the zone. Usually, it need not be called directly by the user.
method.shortDescription: The contains method determines whether a point is inside the zone.
method.result: true if point is inside the zone, false if it is outside.

param.name: x
param.description: The x coordinate of the location to test for.

param.name: y
param.description: The y coordinate of the location to test for.

method.name: getArea
method.description: The getArea method returns the size of the zone. This method is used by the MultiZone class. Usually, it need not be called directly by the user.
method.shortDescription: The getArea method returns the size of the zone.
method.result: a random point inside the zone.

method.name: getLocation
method.description: The getLocation method returns a random point inside the zone. This method is used by the initializers and actions that use the zone. Usually, it need not be called directly by the user.
method.shortDescription: The getLocation method returns a random point inside the zone.
method.result: a random point inside the zone.

asClass.name: Particle
asClass.description:
The Particle class is a set of public properties shared by all particles. It is deliberately lightweight, with only one method. The Initializers and Actions modify these properties directly. This means that the same particles can be used in many different emitters, allowing Particle objects to be shared.
Particles are usually created by the ParticleCreator class. This class just simplifies the reuse of Particle objects which speeds up the application.
asClass.shortDescription: The Particle class is a set of public properties shared by all particles.

constructor.name: Particle
constructor.description: Creates a particle. Alternatively particles can be reused by using the ParticleCreator to create and manage them. Usually the emitter will create the particles and the user doesn't need to create them.
constructor.shortDescription: Creates a particle.

method.name: initialize
method.description: Sets the particles properties to their default values.
method.shortDescription: Sets the particles properties to their default values.

field.name: age
field.description: The age of the particle, in seconds.
field.shortDescription: The age of the particle, in seconds.

field.name: angVelocity
field.description: The angular velocity of the particle in radians per second.
field.shortDescription: The angular velocity of the particle in radians per second.

field.name: color
field.description: The 32bit ARGB color of the particle. The initial value is 0xFFFFFFFF (white).
field.shortDescription: The 32bit ARGB color of the particle.

field.name: energy
field.description: The energy of the particle.
field.shortDescription: The energy of the particle.

field.name: image
field.description: The DisplayObject used to display the image.
field.shortDescription: The DisplayObject used to display the image.

field.description: Whether the particle is dead and should be removed from the stage.

field.shortDescription: The lifetime of the particle, in seconds.

field.shortDescription: The rotation of the particle in radians.

field.name: scale
field.description: The scale of the particle ( 1 is normal size ).
field.shortDescription: The scale of the particle ( 1 is normal size ).

field.description: The position in the emitter's horizontal spacial sorted array
field.shortDescription: The position in the emitter's horizontal spacial sorted array

field.description: The x coordinate of the velocity of the particle in pixels per second.
field.shortDescription: The x coordinate of the velocity of the particle in pixels per second.

field.name: velY
field.description: The y coordinate of the velocity of the particle in pixels per second.
field.shortDescription: The y coordinate of the velocity of the particle in pixels per second.

field.description: The x coordinate of the particle in pixels.
field.shortDescription: The x coordinate of the particle in pixels.

field.name: y
field.description: The y coordinate of the particle in pixels.
field.shortDescription: The y coordinate of the particle in pixels.

field.description: A ColorTransform object that converts white to the colour of the particle.
field.shortDescription: A ColorTransform object that converts white to the colour of the particle.

field.name: dictionary
field.description: The dictionary object enables actions and activities to add additional properties to the particle. Any object adding properties to the particle should use a reference to itself as the dictionary key, thus ensuring it doesn't clash with other object's properties. If multiple properties are needed, the dictionary value can be an object with a number of properties.
field.shortDescription: The dictionary object enables actions and activities to add additional properties to the particle.

field.name: matrixTransform
field.description: A transformation matrix for the position, scale and rotation of the particle.
field.shortDescription: A transformation matrix for the position, scale and rotation of the particle.

asClass.name: ParticleCreator
asClass.description: The ParticleCreator is used by the Emitter class tomanage the creation and reuse of particles. To speed up the particle system, the ParticleCreator class maintains a pool of dead particles and reuses them when a new particle is needed, rather than creating a whole ne particle.
asClass.shortDescription: The ParticleCreator is used by the Emitter class tomanage the creation and reuse of particles.

constructor.name: Lifetime
constructor.description:
The constructor creates a Lifetime initializer for use by an emitter. To add a Lifetime to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addInitializer method.

The lifetime of particles initialized by this class will be a random value between the minimum and maximum values set. If no maximum value is set, the minimum value is used with no variation.

param.description: the maximum lifetime for particles initialized by the instance.

asClass.name: Velocity
asClass.description:
The ColorInit Initializer sets the velocity of the particle. It is usually combined with the Move action to move the particle using this velocity.

The initial velocity is defined using a zone from the org.flintparticles.zones package. The use of zones enables diverse ranges of velocities. For example, to use a specific velocity, a Point zone can be used. To use a varied speed in a specific direction, a LineZone zone can be used. For a fixed speed in a varied direction, a Disc or DiscSector zone with identical inner and outer radius can be used. A Disc or DiscSector with different inner and outer radius produces a range of speeds in a range of directions.
asClass.shortDescription: The ColorInit Initializer sets the velocity of the particle.

asClass.description:
The Position Initializer sets the initial location of the particle.

The class uses zones to place the particle. A zone defines an area of the stage and the particle is placed at a random point within that area. For precise placement, the Point zone defines a single point at which all particles will be placed. Various zones (and the Zones interface for use when implementing custom zones) are defined in the org.flintparticles.zones package.
asClass.shortDescription: The Position Initializer sets the initial location of the particle.

constructor.name: AlphaInit
constructor.description:
The constructor creates an AlphaInit initializer for use by an emitter. To add an AlphaInit to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addInitializer method.

The alpha of particles initialized by this class will be a random value between the minimum and maximum values set. If no maximum value is set, the minimum value is used with no variation.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates an AlphaInit initializer for use by an emitter.

param.name: minAlpha
param.description: the minimum alpha for particles initialized by the instance. The value should be between 1 and 0.

param.name: maxAlpha
param.description: the maximum alpha for particles initialized by the instance. The value should be between 1 and 0.

asClass.name: SharedImage
asClass.description:
The SharedImage Initializer sets the DisplayObject to use to draw the particle. It is used with the BitmapEmitter. When using the DisplayObjectEmitter the ImageClass Initializer must be used.
With the BitmapEmitter, the DisplayObject is copied into the bitmap using the particle's property to place the image correctly. So many particles can share the same DisplayObject because it is only indirectly used to display the particle.
asClass.shortDescription: The SharedImage Initializer sets the DisplayObject to use to draw the particle.

asClass.name: Initializer
asClass.description:
The Initializer class is the abstract base class for all particle initializers. Instances of the Initializer class should not be directly created because the Initializer class itself simply defines default methods that do nothing. Classes that extend the Initializer class implement their own functionality for the methods they want to use. The Initializer interface must be implemented by all particle initializers.

An Initializer is a class that is used to set an aspect of a particle when it is created. Initializers may, for example, set an initial velocity for a particle.

Initializers are added to all particles created by an emitter by using the emitter's addInitializer method.
asClass.shortDescription: The Initializer class is the abstract base class for all particle initializers.

asClass.name: Activity
asClass.description:
The Activity class is the abstract base class for all emitter activities. Instances of the Activity class should not be directly created because the Activity class itself simply defines default methods that do nothing. Classes that extend the Activity class implement their own functionality for the methods they want to use.

An Activity is a class that is used to modify the behaviour of the emitter over time. It may, for example, move or rotate the emitter.

Activities are added to the emitter by using its addActivity method.

asClass.name: BitmapEmitter
asClass.description:
The BitmapEmitter is an emitter that manages its particles by drawing them all onto a single Bitmap display object.

The image to be used for each particle is a DisplayObject, but this DisplayObject is not used directly but is, rather, copied into the bitmap with the various properties of the particle applied. Consequently each each particle may be represented by the same DisplayObject instance and the SharedImage initializer can be used with this emitter.

The BitmapEmitter allows the use of BitmapFilters to modify the appearance of the bitmap. Every frame, under normal circumstances, the Bitmap used to display the particles is wiped clean before all the particles are redrawn. However, if one or more filters aare added to the emitter, the filters are applied to the bitmap instead of wiping it clean. This enables various trail effects by using blur and other filters.
asClass.shortDescription: The BitmapEmitter is an emitter that manages its particles by drawing them all onto a single Bitmap display object.

asClass.name: DisplayObjectEmitter
asClass.description:
The DisplayObjectEmitter is an emitter that manages its particles by adding them to its display list and letting the flash renderer deal will displaying them.

Consequently particle must be represented by a DisplayObject, and each must use a different DisplayObject instance. The DisplayObject to be used should not be defined using the SharedImage initializer because this shares one DisplayObject instance between all the particles. The ImageClass initializer is commonly used because this creates a new DisplayObject for each particle.
asClass.shortDescription: The DisplayObjectEmitter is an emitter that manages its particles by adding them to its display list and letting the flash renderer deal will displaying them.

method.description: Used internally. When created, the particle is added to the emitter's display list.
method.shortDescription: Used internally.

method.name: particleDestroyed
method.description: Used internally. When destroyed, the particle is removed from the emitter's display list.
method.shortDescription: Used internally.

method.name: render
method.description: Used internally. During the update phase, the particle's properties are copied to the DisplayObject representing the particle.
method.shortDescription: Used internally.

asClass.name: Emitter
asClass.description:
The base class for all particle emitters. The Emitter class extends the Sprite class so it is itself a DisplayObject. Thus, an Emitter is displayed by simply adding it as a child to a DisplayObjectContainer.

At its core, the Emitter class manages the creation and ongoing state of particles. It uses a number of utility classes to customise its behaviour.

An emitter uses Initializers to customise the initial state of particles that it creates. These are added to the emitter using the addInitializer method.

An emitter uses Actions to customise the behaviour of particles that it creates. These are added to the emitter using the addAction method.

An emitter uses Activities to customise its own behaviour, such as its position and rotation.

An emitter uses a Counter to know when and how many particles to emit.

All timings in the emitter are based on actual time passed, not on frames.

The emitter base class does not display the particles it creates. This is usually handled in one of the derived classes like BitmapEmitter and DisplayObjectEmitter.

Most other functionality is est added to an emitter using Actions, Initializers, Activities and Counters. This offers greater flexibility to combine behaviours witout needing to further subclass the Emitter itself.
asClass.shortDescription: The base class for all particle emitters.

event.name: emitterEmpty
event.description: Dispatched when an emitter contains no particles. Used, for example, to remove an emitter when it contains no particles.
event.shortDescription: Dispatched when an emitter contains no particles.

event.name: particleDead
event.description: Dispatched when a particle dies and is about to be removed from the system. As soon as the event has been handled the particle will be removed but at the time of the event it still exists so its properties (e.g. its location) can be read from it.
event.shortDescription: Dispatched when a particle dies and is about to be removed from the system.

constructor.name: Emitter
constructor.description: The constructor creates an emitter. However, it is more common to create one of the subclasses that implements a specific display method.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates an emitter.

method.name: addAction
method.description: Adds an Action object to the Emitter. Actions set the behaviour of particles created by the emitter.
method.shortDescription: Adds an Action object to the Emitter.

param.name: action
param.description: The Action to add

param.name: priority
param.description: Indicates the sequencing of the actions. Higher numbers cause an action to be run before other actions. All actions have a default priority which is used if no value is passed in this parameter. The default priority is usually the one you want so this parameter is only used when you need to override the default.

method.name: addActivity
method.description: Adds an Activity to the Emitter. Activities set the behaviour of the Emitter.
method.shortDescription: Adds an Activity to the Emitter.

param.name: activity
param.description: The activity to add

param.name: priority
param.description: Indicates the sequencing of the activities. Higher numbers cause an activity to be run before other activities. All activities have a default priority which is used if no value is passed in this parameter. The default priority is usually the one you want so this parameter is only used when you need to override the default.

method.name: addInitializer
method.description: Adds an Initializer object to the Emitter. Initializers set the initial properties of particles created by the emitter.
method.shortDescription: Adds an Initializer object to the Emitter.

param.name: initializer
param.description: The Initializer to add

param.name: priority
param.description: Indicates the sequencing of the initializers. Higher numbers cause an initializer to be run before other initialzers. All initializers have a default priority which is used if no value is passed in this parameter. The default priority is usually the one you want so this parameter is only used when you need to override the default.

method.description: Used internally and in derived classes to update the emitter.

method.name: globalToLocal
method.description: Converts the point object from the Stage (global) coordinates to the emitter's (local) coordinates.
method.shortDescription: Converts the point object from the Stage (global) coordinates to the emitter's (local) coordinates.
method.result: A Point object with coordinates relative to the display object.

param.name: point
param.description: An object created with the Point class. The Point object specifies the x and y coordinates as properties.

method.name: localToGlobal
method.description: Converts the point object from the emitter's (local) coordinates to the Stage (global) coordinates.
method.shortDescription: Converts the point object from the emitter's (local) coordinates to the Stage (global) coordinates.
method.result: A Point object with coordinates relative to the Stage.

param.name: point
param.description: The name or identifier of a point created with the Point class, specifying the x and y coordinates as properties.

method.name: runAhead
method.description: Makes the emitter skip forwards a period of time with a single update. Used when you want the emitter to look like it's been running for a while.
method.shortDescription: Makes the emitter skip forwards a period of time with a single update.

param.name: time
param.description: The time, in seconds, to skip ahead.

param.name: frameRate
param.description: The frame rate for calculating the new positions. The emitter will calculate each frame over the time period tp get the new state for the emitter and its particles. A higher frameRate will be more accurate but will take longer to calculate.

method.description: Starts the emitter. Until start is called, the emitter will not emit any particles.

asClass.name: Age
asClass.description:
The Age action operates in conjunction with the Lifetime initializer. The Lifetime initializer sets the lifetime for the particle. The Age action then ages the particle over time, altering its energy to reflect its age. This energy can then be used by actions like Fade and ColorChange to alter the appearence of the particle as it ages.

When the particle's lifetime is over, this action marks it as dead.

When adjusting the energy this action can use any of the eassing functions in the org.flintparticles.energy package.
asClass.shortDescription: The Age action operates in conjunction with the Lifetime initializer.

param.description: an easing function to use to modify the energy curve over the lifetime of the particle. The default null produces a linear response with no easing.

asClass.name: Action
asClass.description:
The Action class is the abstract base class for all particle actions. Instances of the Action class should not be directly created because the Action class itself simply defines default methods that do nothing. Classes that extend the Action class implement their own functionality for the methods they want to use.

An Action is a class that is used to modify an aspect of a particle every frame. Actions may, for example, move the particle of modify its velocity.

Actions are added to all particles created by an emitter by using the emitter's addAction method.
asClass.shortDescription: The Action class is the abstract base class for all particle actions.

constructor.name: Action
constructor.description: The constructor creates an Action object. But you shouldn't use it because the Action class is abstract.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates an Action object.

method.name: addedToEmitter
method.description: The addedToEmitter method is called by the emitter when the Action is added to it It is called within the emitter's addAction method and need not be called by the user.
method.shortDescription: The addedToEmitter method is called by the emitter when the Action is added to it It is called within the emitter's addAction method and need not be called by the user.

param.name: emitter
param.description: The Emitter that the Action was added to.

method.name: getDefaultPriority
method.description: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of actions. It is called within the emitter's addAction method when the user doesn't manually set a priority. It need not be called directly by the user.
method.shortDescription: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of actions.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.shortDescription: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle.

param.name: emitter
param.description: The Emitter that created the particle.

param.name: particle
param.description: The particle to be updated.

param.name: time
param.description: The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

asClass.name: TurnTowardsMouse
asClass.description: The TurnTowardsMouse action causes the particle to constantly adjust its direction so that it travels towards the mouse pointer.
asClass.shortDescription: The TurnTowardsMouse action causes the particle to constantly adjust its direction so that it travels towards the mouse pointer.

method.name: addedToEmitter
method.shortDescription: The addedToEmitter method is called by the emitter when the Action is added to it It is called within the emitter's addAction method and need not be called by the user.

method.name: getDefaultPriority
method.shortDescription: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of actions.

constructor.name: TurnTowardsMouse
constructor.description: The constructor creates a TurnTowardsMouse action for use by an emitter. To add a TurnTowardsMouse to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a TurnTowardsMouse action for use by an emitter.

param.name: power
param.description: The strength of the turn action. Higher values produce a sharper turn.

asClass.name: RotationalQuadraticDrag
asClass.description: The RotationalQuadraticDrag action applies drag to the particle to slow it down when it's rotating. The drag force is proportional to the square of the angular velocity of the particle.
asClass.shortDescription: The RotationalQuadraticDrag action applies drag to the particle to slow it down when it's rotating.

asClass.name: RotationalFriction
asClass.description: The RotationalFriction action applies friction to the particle's rotational movement to slow it down when it's rotating. The frictional force is constant, irrespective of how fast the particle is rotating. For forces proportional to the particle's angular velocity, use one of the rotational drag effects - RotationalLinearDrag and RotationalQuadraticDrag.
asClass.shortDescription: The RotationalFriction action applies friction to the particle's rotational movement to slow it down when it's rotating.

asClass.name: MouseExplosion
asClass.description: The MouseExplosion action applies a force on the particle to push it away from the mouse. The force applied is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the particle to the mouse.
asClass.shortDescription: The MouseExplosion action applies a force on the particle to push it away from the mouse.

method.name: addedToEmitter
method.shortDescription: The addedToEmitter method is called by the emitter when the Action is added to it It is called within the emitter's addAction method and need not be called by the user.

method.name: getDefaultPriority
method.shortDescription: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of actions.

constructor.name: MouseExplosion
constructor.description: The constructor creates a MouseExplosion action for use by an emitter. To add a MouseExplosion to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a MouseExplosion action for use by an emitter.

param.name: power
param.description: The minimum distance for which the explosion force is calculated. Particles closer than this distance experience the explosion as it they were this distance away. This stops the explosion effect blowing up as distances get small.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.shortDescription: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle.

param.description: The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

field.name: epsilon
field.description: The minimum distance for which the explosion force is calculated. Particles closer than this distance experience the explosion as it they were this distance away. This stops the explosion effect blowing up as distances get small.
field.shortDescription: The minimum distance for which the explosion force is calculated.

field.name: power
field.description: The strength of the explosive force.
field.shortDescription: The strength of the explosive force.

asClass.name: MouseGravity
asClass.description: The MouseGravity action applies a force on the particle to draw it towards the mouse. The force applied is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the particle to the mouse.
asClass.shortDescription: The MouseGravity action applies a force on the particle to draw it towards the mouse.

method.name: addedToEmitter
method.shortDescription: The addedToEmitter method is called by the emitter when the Action is added to it It is called within the emitter's addAction method and need not be called by the user.

method.name: getDefaultPriority
method.shortDescription: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of actions.

constructor.name: MouseGravity
constructor.description: The constructor creates a MouseGravity action for use by an emitter. To add a MouseGravity to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a MouseGravity action for use by an emitter.

param.name: power
param.description: The strength of the force - larger numbers produce a stringer force.

param.name: epsilon
param.description: The minimum distance for which gravity is calculated. Particles closer than this distance experience a gravity force as it they were this distance away. This stops the gravity effect blowing up as distances get small. For realistic gravity effects you will want a small epsilon ( ~1 ), but for stable visual effects a larger epsilon (~100) is often better.

field.shortDescription: The minimum distance for which the gravity force is calculated.

field.name: power
field.description: The strength of the gravity force.
field.shortDescription: The strength of the gravity force.

asClass.name: GravityWell
asClass.description: The GravityWell action applies a force on the particle to draw it towards a single point. The force applied is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the particle to the point.
asClass.shortDescription: The GravityWell action applies a force on the particle to draw it towards a single point.

constructor.description: The constructor creates a GravityWell action for use by an emitter. To add a GravityWell to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a GravityWell action for use by an emitter.

param.name: power
param.description: The strength of the force - larger numbers produce a stringer force.

param.name: x
param.description: The x coordinate of the point towards which the force draws the particles.

param.name: y
param.description: The y coordinate of the point towards which the force draws the particles.

param.name: epsilon
param.description: The minimum distance for which gravity is calculated. Particles closer than this distance experience a gravity force as it they were this distance away. This stops the gravity effect blowing up as distances get small. For realistic gravity effects you will want a small epsilon ( ~1 ), but for stable visual effects a larger epsilon (~100) is often better.

asClass.name: Dot
asClass.description: The Dot class is a DisplayObject that displays a dot. The dot is always white because colour is applied using one of the particle Actions.
asClass.shortDescription: The Dot class is a DisplayObject that displays a dot.

constructor.name: Dot
constructor.description: The constructor creates a Dot with a specified radius.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a Dot with a specified radius.

param.name: radius
param.description: The radius, in pixels, of the Dot.

asClass.name: Line
asClass.description: The LineShape class is a DisplayObject that displays a line. The line is always white because colour is applied using one of the particle Actions.
asClass.shortDescription: The LineShape class is a DisplayObject that displays a line.

constructor.name: Line
constructor.description: The constructor creates a Line with a specified length.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a Line with a specified length.

param.name: lineLength
param.description: The length, in pixels, of the line.

asClass.name: Rect
asClass.description: The Rect class is a DisplayObject that displays a rectangle. The rectangle is always white because colour is applied using one of the particle Actions.
asClass.shortDescription: The Rect class is a DisplayObject that displays a rectangle.

constructor.name: Rect
constructor.description: The constructor creates a Rect with a specified width and height.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a Rect with a specified width and height.

param.name: width
param.description: The width, in pixels, of the rectangle.

param.name: height
param.description: The height, in pixels, of the rectangle.

asClass.name: Star
asClass.description: The Star class is a DisplayObject that displays a five point star. The star is always white because colour is applied using one of the particle Actions.
asClass.shortDescription: The Star class is a DisplayObject that displays a five point star.

constructor.name: Star
constructor.description: The constructor creates a Star with a specified radius.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a Star with a specified radius.

param.name: radius
param.description: The radius, in pixels, of the Star.

asClass.name: RadialDot
asClass.description: The RadialDot class is a DisplayObject that displays a dot with a gradient fill that fades to transparency at the edge of the dot. The RadialDot is always white because colour is applied using one of the particle Actions.
asClass.shortDescription: The RadialDot class is a DisplayObject that displays a dot with a gradient fill that fades to transparency at the edge of the dot.

constructor.name: RadialDot
constructor.description: The constructor creates a RadialDot with a specified radius.
constructor.shortDescription: The constructor creates a RadialDot with a specified radius.

param.name: radius
param.description: The radius, in pixels, of the RadialDot.
